title: Save SA to host 'real' SONA in Cape Town | News24

locations.name: cape town - the save south africa

text:
Cape Town - The Save South Africa campaign will host a People's Assembly on the “real” State of the Nation in Cape Town on Wednesday. 
The event will be held in St George's Cathedral, opposite Parliament, starting at 10:00. 
In its invite, the campaign listed six objectives in holding the alternative address a day before President Jacob Zuma is due to open Parliament on Thursday. 
- Read more: Zuma deploys 441 soldiers for law and order during SONA 2017 
The campaign hopes to get a diverse crowd of people from all sectors of civil society to demand Zuma’s resignation, increase political accountability, and to stop the nuclear energy deal. 
“The real SONA is a dynamic and vibrant discussion that highlights the real issues facing South Africa, as well as the solutions to our crisis,” it reads. 
“Come armed with your ideas for the real SONA and pin them to our SONA wall.” 
The official SONA will deny the real problems facing South Africans, including service delivery, the economy, political unrest, and corruption, the campaign said. 
It hoped to cement a partnership with the Energy Justice campaign to create wider awareness of the pending nuclear energy deal and lay a foundation for a national campaign to halt the nuclear deal this year. It called it “Zuma’s greatest tender grab”. 
Save SA urged South Africans to attend the event, to sign the “People's Motion of No Confidence” online and to write to or contact their MPs about the nuclear deal. 
It said it would publish the list of all MPs and their contact details on its Join the conversation!
